content.question: The author most likely chose to introduce her argument by way of a personal anecdote in order to

choices.label: share the perspective of someone usually regarded as a typical Wyoming resident
invite the audience to empathize with the difficulties she faced growing up in Wyoming
challenge her audience’s assumptions about Wyoming residents
disclose events that might have made her unintentionally biased

content.answer: challenge her audience’s assumptions about Wyoming residents

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe components of the rhetorical situation - the exigence, audience, purpose, context, and message.
